document_data.name: Summon Monster V
document_data.refs3e: {{cite book/Player's Handbook v.3.5|286-287}}{{cite book/Oriental Adventures (3rd edition)|95}}{{cite book/Unapproachable East|27}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Summon monster V''''', also called '''''monster summoning V''''', was an [[Arcane magic|arcane]] [[conjuration]] [[spell]] and one of the series of ''[[summon monster]]'' spells available to spellcasters .
document_data.Effects:
This spell summoned a [[monster]] to aid the caster. The monster could be a [[hound archon]], an [[elemental]] around man-size, an [[achaierai]], [[bearded devil]], [[shadow mastiff]], or a celestial animal: the selection for those included normally [[brown bear]], [[stag beetle]] or [[griffon]]. It could also summon a fiendish animal: that animal could be a [[deinonychus]], a [[dire ape]], a [[dire boar]], a [[monstrous scorpion]] the size of a horse, a [[dire wolverine]], a [[giant crocodile]] or a [[tiger]]. In aquatic environments, it could summon instead a celestial [[sea cat]] or a fiendish [[shark]] the size of an elephant. When cast to summon a creature of a given alignment, the spell's descriptor matched it.

In the version most often used prior to the {{yearlinkName|1372}}, up to three creatures were summoned: examples of monsters that could be summoned included [[ankheg]]s, [[cockatrice]]s, [[displacer beast]]s, [[doppleganger]]s, [[giant hornet]]s, [[hydra]]s, [[leucrotta]]s, [[subterranean lizard]]s, [[wereboar]]s, [[margoyle]]s, [[minotaur]]s, [[ochre jelly|ochre jellies]], [[rust monster]]s, [[slithering tracker]]s, [[giant snake]], [[giant spider]]s, [[verbeeg]]s, [[winter wolf|winter volves]], and [[ju-ju zombie]]s.{{cite book/Monstrous Manual|377}} In fresh water it would only summon [[giant crocodile]]s, giant [[electric eel]]s, [[scrag]]s, or [[water weird]]s.{{cite book/Monstrous Manual|378}}
document_data.Components: In addition to [[Verbal component|verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, this spell required as [[material component]]s a small bag and tiny [[candle]] to cast. The candle did not need to be lit for the spell to function.
document_data.History:
The spell was originally called '''''Lucke's 5{{th}} Monster Summons''''', and was developed by [[Lucke]] in {{yearlinkConvert|2025|NY}}.
This spell was used by [[Dyrr]], the Lichdrow of [[Menzoberranzan]].{{Cite dragon/312/Rogues Gallery: The Heroes of the War of the Spider Queen, Part 2|84-85}}
